title: The NBA and China: What the Stock Market Thinks
text:
The National Basketball Association just hit a major roadblock in China after Houston Rockets general manager Daryl Morey expressed support for Hong Kong protestors on Twitter: “Fight for freedom. Stand with Hong Kong.”

The post, which Morey quickly removed, sparked outraged in China. The Chinese Consulate General in Houston urged the team to “correct the error.” According to The Wall Street Journal, the team was pulled from Chinese broadcast channels, while sales of Rockets merchandise on Alibaba Group Holding (ticker: BABA)...
description: Houston Rockets general manager Daryl Morey, owner Tilman Fertitta, the NBA, and Rockets star James Harden all apologized to Chinese fans for a tweet that offered support to Hong Kong. Nike stock, exposed to China and the NBA, rose slightly.
